column4: Try gksudo nautilus to get rid of directories;CAUTION, make sure you have back-ups of your data prior to initiating,...
why do I sudo nautilus? I don't really get it. thanks.
That will allow you to have temporary root privleges in Nautilus if the directories are not owned by you.

ok. but that is not my question at all. In terminal, to remove an empty directory, I can use rmdir. if the directory is not empty, it will give me warning. this is good and safe. I am just wondering if nautilus has the same functionality. so when to delete a directory, it will warn you whether that is empty or not. currently, it doesn't.
In Nautilus, if it's empty, won't it sat "0" files???
it doesn't say anything useful. just warn you you are about to delete a directory. that's all.
I only use terminal as a last resort; I prefer GUI, hence my suggestion of Nautilus; if I was unclear, I apologize.
no worries. thanks for your help.
But you know what happens when one assumes. :-)
Since there's a problem, I wouldn't close anything; just let it "do it's thing".
I have restarted the laptop. I have partial 11.10 now. what to do? thanks.
I know it's not what you wanna' hear, but, I have no idea why. :-(
thanks for the reply. it doesn't matter why now. what to do next to have a full 11.10 installation?
Hope you backed up everything prior to; any specific error messages, other than couldn't upgrade?
no error message at all. it just said the upgrade is aborted.
Also, I'm on 10.04, so I'm not sure how much help I can be, trouble-shooting 11.10. I'd just keep trying it until something goes "Hinckey." I wonder if it may have been a 'false error message'.
